Advanced Time Tracking: Flexible view of issues time tracking data
Title: Title:
Problem Description: Send collected support data to reproduce the problem.
If Incomplete: If timesheet is not complete for the period
All changes will be saved automatically: All changes will be saved automatically.
description.Auditors Groups: Only users of the selected groups will be allowed to see time spent by other users.
description.Auditors Roles: Only users of the selected roles will be allowed to see time spent by other users.
description.Composition Issue Link: If specified, Timesheet and Pivot reports will aggregate hours, into parent issue, using specified issue link in addition to sub tasks.
description.Parent Issue Field: If specified, reports will aggregate hours, into parent issue, using specified issue field in addition to sub tasks. Only Jira Agile "Epic Link" is supported.
description.Parent Issue Type: If specified, reports will aggregate hours, into parent issue, using Jira Portfolio issue hierarchy. Specify Jira Portfolio parent issue type here.
description.Weekend Type: Weekend days can be specified using this option.
description.Preserve Started Time: Do not convert worklog started time to current user timezone. See also Multiple Time Zones for information about default behaviour.
description.Time In Status Categories: Status Categories of Statuses that should be included in Time In Status report (allows to exclude Resolved Statuses). All statuses are included unless anything specified.
description.Working Time In Status: Use Working Time for calculating hours in Time in Status and Resolution Time reports (otherwise, all elapsed time is used), e.g. 9 - 17.
description.Started Time In Status: Use worklog started time only for Pivot by Status report (do not split timespent between statuses; not applicable for Time in Status report).
description.Duration Type: Duration format to display hours. E.g. '1d 2h 30m' in case of Pretty Duration, 1.2d in case of Days, or 10.5h by default.
description.Disable Problem Reporter: Do not suggest to report unexpected errors.
description.Maximum Fraction Digits: Maximum Fraction Digits used to display hours
description.Track Support Data: If enabled, support data will be collected, and could be sent by email to support to reproduce a problem.
description.Worklog Visibility Group: First of the selected groups user is member of, will be set for Worklog Visibility.
description.Worklog Visibility Role: First of the selected roles user has, will be set for Worklog Visibility.
description.User Groups With Time Entry: Users of the selected groups will be able to use Time Entry issue panel to record worked hours in real time. Note, OR logic is used for related settings (Time Entry Issue Panel Groups and Time Entry Issue Panel Projects).
description.Projects With Time Entry Pan: Issues of the selected projects will have Time Entry issue panel to record worked hours in real time. Note, OR logic is used for related settings (Time Entry Issue Panel Groups and Time Entry Issue Panel Projects).
description.Work Labels: Editable list of labels that can be used in worklog comment as hashtags, for grouping.
description.Disable Log Work: If enabled, logging work or updating entries in the reports will not be possible for anyone.
description.Work Description Required: Require Work Description when adding or updating worklog.
description.Cache Worklog: If enabled, use local Storage for issues with more than 20 worklogs. Worklogs added last minute anywhere else will be missing in report.
description.REST: Get KEY to load worklog in JSON format from https://timesheet-plugin.herokuapp.com/api/1/worklog with HTTP Header "Authorization: Apikey KEY." See also REST endpoint.
description.Time Tracking Columns: These columns will be shown in Time Tracking Report and exported to files. Columns order will be the same. Please note, if nothing selected, all columns with default order will be shown.
description.Time Balance Columns: These columns will be shown in Time Balance Report and exported to files. Columns order will be the same. Please note, if nothing selected, all columns with default order will be shown.
description.Columns For Export: Base columns for export in exportData files. If nothing selected, all will be processed. Order is predefined.
description.In Progress Issues jql: Specify JQL to always show issues in Timesheet in basic self user view and in Time Entry, e.g. 'assignee = currentUser() and status = "In Progress"'.
description.Date Fields: Date Fields for query, combined with OR in JQL, 'created or updated' if nothing selected for Time Tracking and Time Balance reports
description.Link For Mobile Devices: Send Link For Timesheet Progressive Web Application to you email. See also documentation.
description.Log Work For Others Groups: Users of the selected groups will be allowed to Log Work on Behalf of Other Users.
Data is limited by Auditors Roles: Because of the Auditors Roles configured, data is limited to own worklogs for the following project(s):
error.restriction.auditorsGroups: You are not in auditors group. Please select yourself in User field to see own worklogs.
error.startDate.afterNow: The Start Date is in the future.
error.startDate.afterEnd: The Start Date is later than the End Date.
error.workLabel.emptyUnique: Work Label must not be empty and be unique.
error.cannotLogWorkIssue: Work can not be logged for the issue.
welcome.title: Welcome to Time Reports
welcome.subTitle: Getting started with Time Reports
welcome.content.1: Time Reports for Jira Cloud extends built-in Jira timetracking means with next Reports:
welcome.content.2.0: provides convenient way to record worked hours in real time, i.e. start, stop, resume timer, log worked done or edit previous records.
welcome.content.2.1: provides the most extensive means to analyze users' workload. It has classical sheet view by day. Also with numerous report Options it is possible to get few variants of the report.
welcome.content.2.1.1: provides simple mean to analyze workload. It has classical sheet view with only Time Spent column. Also with numerous report Options it is possible to get few variants of the report.
welcome.content.2.2: displays a summary of worked hours for project for certain period, where columns are project users (resources) and rows are project issues (tasks).
welcome.content.2.3: displays time worked on issues in each issue status. This report spreads worked hours across statuses issue had starting from work started time. It may be changed not to spread worked hours, but use only work started time, by setting Working Time In Status + Started Time In Status options in configuration.
welcome.content.2.4: displays Estimated Time vs Actual Time Spent per issue (no worklog).
welcome.content.2.5: displays a summary of worked hours for project for certain period in Pie Chart.
welcome.content.2.6: displays time elapsed in particular issue status (no worklog used in this case). It calculates time passed between status changes, basing solely on issue change history. Columns for this report could be filtered with Time In Status Categories option in configuration.
welcome.content.2.6.1: displays changes in Time Balance per issue for certain period.
welcome.content.3: Reports are accessible via Project menu in Jira, under Reports tab, see Time Reports there. See also Jira Documentation for more information.
welcome.content.3.1: It is possible to add Time Entry Issue Panel to record worked hours in real time right from issue, see Time Entry Issue Panel Groups or Time Entry Issue Panel Projects option in configuration.
welcome.content.3.2: Note, Time Reports has system navigation bar and project navigation bar menu item, which is shown for members of user groups selected in Auditors Groups or Time Entry Issue Panel Groups options or for projects selected in Time Entry Issue Panel Projects option, if any configured, or it's possible to add quick link with Application Navigator. It also allows to set link to be viewable just by the specified groups.
welcome.content.3.3: Time Reports can be added to Jira dashboard to provide convenient way to keep an eye on your or your team workload on day to day basis. See Jira Documentation also.
welcome.content.3.4: Time Reports underlying data (worklog) can also be exported to Excel or CSV on report page.
welcome.content.3.5: Timesheet Report can be sent via email regularly (see email icon on Timesheet report page) or exported using REST api or accessed on mobile devices.
